comments.body: Could you clarify the string format

> Could you clarify the string format

Done
should this add some notes on how to resolve this and linux's `run_as_user`. Should runtime fallback to latter if former is not set?

For this I just copied to comments from the fields that already existed on `WindowsContainerSecurityContext` .There are some open issues in k/k (https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/92963) where users are noticing that it is not possible to run the sandbox containers as a different user and this is possible on linux today.

I don't think we can fall back to the `run_as_user` - the types different (`run_as_user` is an Int64 and `run_as_username` is a string) and users are just handled different in linux vs windows.
I'm open to suggestions here.

The description of each field in WindowsSandboxSecurityContext seems to apply to "containers".  Could you change them to better match the intention.

I think it could also use some clarification about whether the properties apply to the sandbox itself or the containers in it, e.g., for Linux, we have
```
1) It does not apply to containers in the pods.
2) It may not be applicable to a PodSandbox which does not contain any running process.
```
The settings will only apply to the pod sandbox itself so a comment like this would be warranted
On Windows the `WindowsSandboxSecurityContext` will only apply to the sandbox container for a pod. I'm updating the comment to reflect that.
how were these fields being sent before?

They just weren't defined for the sandbox itself, they were present (besides `host_process` obviously) on the actual container config but not on this. https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/99576/files/87530d049994ec1aa113743bf1d20e434e422825#diff-583fcb2b2b9fed64e8ac45392565a924918b4a64a7d4b66df0d4bccd298e8769R722-R729
If we are embedding the entire `ImageSpec` here, which includes the image ID, should we remove the `id` field, as it seems redundant?
This was discussed previously and it was recommended to duplicate the field here to ensure backwards compatibility. Let me try and find the relevant discussion.

The last line in the section calls out the duplicated data 
https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/blob/master/keps/sig-windows/windows-runtimeclass-support.md#imagespec-as-part-of-the-image-struct

`Note that the ID field will be potentially duplicated in ImageSpec for backward compatibility.`
Will this change make it into `k8s.io/cri-api`? That's where we get the CRI spec for our code.
yep, it would
Looks okay to me.

should it be `uint` that can be matched with corresponding entry in `/sys/devices/system/node/node*/hugepages/hugepages-*kB`  ?

Or idea to validate it always with what is available in `/sys/fs/cgroup/hugetlb/hugetlb.*` and fail if something doesn't match?

I think it is ok, but updating comment referencing OCI spec https://github.com/opencontainers/runtime-spec/blob/master/config-linux.md#huge-page-limits can be also a good idea. OCI spec is explicit here to define what this string should contain.

I think updating the comment is nice too.

I agree with @kad that using an uint would be nice, but I still thing following the OSI spec is the best solution, so I prefer to keep it as a string. The size prefixes originate from here btw: https://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/linux/kernel/git/torvalds/linux.git/tree/mm/hugetlb_cgroup.c?id=e3280b54afed870d531571212f1fc375df39b7d2#n342
I updated the comments based on [OCI spec](https://github.com/opencontainers/runtime-spec/blob/master/config-linux.md#huge-page-limits).
The API change LGTM. We may need to change the comment to make it clear if we ever supports non-GMSA spects.

@yujuhong : sorry if I'm misunderstanding, but that field's name was requested to not include "GMSA" in https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/75459#discussion_r283044104, and the comment makes it clear it's for GMSA for now; so not sure what else we should do here?

I think this is fine for now. The field name matches the oci field name, and the description is reasonably consistent with the [oci doc](https://github.com/opencontainers/runtime-spec/blob/master/specs-go/config.go#L442-L443).

s/=/-

i.e
s/defined as the memory limit = workingSetBytes/defined as the memory limit - workingSetBytes.

xref: https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/blob/master/staging/src/k8s.io/kubelet/pkg/apis/stats/v1alpha1/types.go#L215
good catch!
can we remove `PodSandboxAttributes` and just return existing `PodSandbox` message instead here?
